title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A new survey shows only 33.7% of Boston residents feel 'less safe' downtown, down from 70.6% last year.
The Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit discussed drug use, petty crime, and cleanliness as ongoing issues.
Retail vacancies are at their lowest since the COVID-19 pandemic, indicating perceived increase in safety.

title: Final: Patriots 24, Falcons 23: New England escapes with win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots defeat the Atlanta Falcons 24-23 at Gillette Stadium in a closely contested game.
Drake London's performance included three touchdowns, but a missed extra point by Parker Romo kept Falcons behind.
Patriots' Drake Maye faced challenges with two turnovers, contributing to ten Falcons points, but secured the win.

title: 10 defendants, including a grandma, indicted in statewide sex trafficking case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Ten defendants indicted for sex trafficking across Essex, Middlesex, Plymouth, and Suffolk counties from March 2023 to September 2025.
Gianni Martinez and grandmother Rosa Garcia from Lynn allegedly coerced women into sex work, demanding earnings from victims.
Five alleged sex buyers, including Mark Barry from Salem, indicted for paying for sexual conduct in joint investigation.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Miles Teller hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Miles Teller hosted 'SNL' on November 2, marking his second time as host, with Brandi Carlile as musical guest.
The political cold open featured Teller in a mock NYC mayoral debate, with appearances from previous SNL hosts.
Brandi Carlile returned for her fourth 'SNL' musical guest appearance, following her Season 50 performance with Elton John.

title: Regulators are limiting a proposed Eversource rate hike in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts regulators denied a $45 million rate hike request by Eversource, potentially saving customers money on heating costs.
Eversource's request would have increased delivery and supply rates for 300,000 NSTAR customers by 13% to 17%.
Governor Maura Healey criticized the proposed hikes, labeling them 'outrageous' and unaffordable for many households.

title: Wayland schools investigating after Black student targeted in racist locker room incident
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Wayland High School is investigating a racist incident involving a Black student's jersey hung with a plastic figure.
School and police officials have identified responsible students and are working with the DA's Office for a thorough investigation.
Wayland has faced previous racial incidents, including one involving former Superintendent Omar Easy and school sport events.

title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics' three-game winning streak ended with a 128-101 loss to the Rockets led by Kevin Durant's 26 points.
Boston played its fifth game in seven nights and committed 28 fouls, contributing to a significant free-throw disparity.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points, while Derrick White and Payton Pritchard struggled from the field.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate D'Ernest Johnson from practice squad to 53-man roster for game against Falcons.
Johnson, a veteran with 671 scrimmage yards in 2021, offers experience amid injuries to Stevenson and Gibson.
With Stevenson injured, TreVeyon Henderson is expected to lead the Patriots' backfield on Sunday.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov anchor Bruins' defense, contributing to team's recent three-game winning streak.
Over 73 minutes of 5-on-5 play, the McAvoy-Zadorov pairing allowed just one goal, strengthening Boston's defense.
Hampus Lindholm's return and Jonathan Aspirot's steady performance aid Bruins' improved defensive efforts.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed one goal in the Bruins' 2-1 victory over the Carolina Hurricanes, enhancing his performance after recent challenges.
Coach Marco Sturm rotated Joonas Korpisalo as the starter due to Swayman's 7-2 loss to Ottawa, prompting Swayman's strong return.
Swayman's season stats still outperform Korpisalo's, with a .896 save percentage and 2.0 goals saved above expected, indicating solid overall performance.
